alert.note: Alert for Dauphin; Lebanon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:12PM EST until January 11 at 2:30PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek near Hershey affecting Lebanon and Dauphin Counties. .Recent rainfall and snowmelt have contributed to rising river levels. The river levels will gradually fall through Friday before rising slowly into the weekend as a result of additional rainfall. For the Swatara Creek...including Hershey...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swatara Creek near Hershey. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, The right, or north bank begins to overflow. Several roadways upstream of the gage are affected by high water. At 8.0 feet, The right, or north bank overflows. Several roads are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EST Wednesday was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.7 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.9 feet on 12/26/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning.
